FIELD.NAME: timecreated

TABLE.NAME: tool_dataflows_steps
TABLE.COMMENT: Steps configuration which are mapped to a particular dataflow

FIELD.NAME: alias
FIELD.COMMENT: A text based id used to connect steps together, reference them for inputs, etc, unique to the dataflow it lies under

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Description for the step, which may include the purpose for its inclusion, more detail about what it does or how it works.

FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.COMMENT: Fully Qualified Class Name of the step.

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Display name for the step, used in the UI and graph

FIELD.NAME: config
FIELD.COMMENT: JSON encoded configuration object, relevant for the step class defined

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The time this record was created

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who created this record

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The time this record was modified.

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Who last modified this record?

KEY.NAME: stepalias_dataflowid
KEY.COMMENT: To ensure the text based id is unique for each dataflow

FIELD.NAME: dependson
FIELD.COMMENT: References the step that the stepid depends on

FIELD.NAME: position
FIELD.COMMENT: The order of the dependencies, which only apply for those with varying number of outputs

TABLE.NAME: tool_dataflows_schedule
TABLE.COMMENT: Times for last run, and the next scheduled run.

FIELD.NAME: lastruntime
FIELD.COMMENT: The time the dataflow was last scheduled to be run

FIELD.NAME: nextruntime
FIELD.COMMENT: The time the dataflow is next scheduled to be run

TABLE.NAME: tool_dataflows_runs
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores the dataflow runs, point in time configuration, state and other fields used for reporting

FIELD.NAME: dataflowid
FIELD.COMMENT: This is the dataflow that this run is originally based on.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who started this particular run

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: The current state of the run as a string, e.g. running, pausing, paused, finished, etc.

FIELD.NAME: timestarted
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp of when the run started

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Identifier of the run, typically a single digit per unique run. A semver value, e.g. 1.1 if a run is re-executed using the same inputs

FIELD.NAME: currentstate
FIELD.COMMENT: The current state of this run. This might be persisted after some time has elapsed since it started as a means of recovery, or if the user has paused the dataflow, such that it can be resumed at a later time.

INDEX.NAME: dataflowid_name
INDEX.COMMENT: Each dataflow should have a run with a unique name

TABLE.NAME: tool_dataflows_logs
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores the logs for the dataflow execution

FIELD.NAME: level
FIELD.COMMENT: The logging level (e.g. DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL, TRACE)

FIELD.NAME: group
FIELD.COMMENT: Grouping for logs. Can be used to filter logs for different steps (e.g. by their alias or similar) using something such as step.alias

FIELD.NAME: message
FIELD.COMMENT: Content of the logged entry

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp of the log entry

TABLE.NAME: tool_dataflows_versions

FIELD.COMMENT: Yaml of the config

FIELD.NAME: timestamp
FIELD.COMMENT: Time of the lock

FIELD.NAME: processid
FIELD.COMMENT: Process ID
